newsitem.title: FINLAND: UPM, M-SERLA TO HOLD JOINT INFO.
newsitem.headline: UPM, M-SERLA TO HOLD JOINT INFO.

text.p: Finnish forest industry groups UPM-Kymmene and Metsa-Serla said on Tuesday they would hold a news conference at 1200/1000 GMT at Hotel Palace in Helsinki.
A spokeswoman for UPM, Europe's largest forestry group, and an official at Metsa-Serla's main owner Metsaliitto said the news conference was about a "significant corporate arrangement".
A Metsaliitto spokesman confirmed that it would be a joint news conference.
The Helsinki bourse earlier said trade in shares of both firms had been suspended at their own request.
Analysts asked to speculate on the news said the companies are highly unlikely to announce a merger but may signal some kind of asset swap, analysts said.
"A merger would be highly unlikely, 'significant corporate arrangement' signals some swaps in units or factories," said one, requesting anonymity amid speculation.

"My rough guess would be (the news will involve) an elimination of cross-ownership in (pulp mills) Metsa-Rauma and Metsa-Botnia -- this is shooting from the hip," said Lars Kjellberg at Enskilda Bank in Stockholm.
Both have holdings in the pulp mills.
UPM-Kymmene has officially been in operation since May through the merger of Repola and Kymmene. Metsa-Serla is mainly owned by cooperative Metsaliitto.
